children.text2: The following shows how to update a configuration item.

children.name: input
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Input payload. A JSON formatted string of configuration items to add or update. 
"input" { 
 "items": [Array],
 "referenceItems": [Array],
 "relations": [Array]
}

children.name: <String>
children.text:
A JSON formatted string that is a list of results for the configuration items in the input string. Each result string is in the format Â 'items: [{}], relations:[{}]', where each item within the items and relations lists contains name-value pairs.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems
children.text: No values are currently returned.

children.name: input.items
children.text: Array

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var payload = {items: [ {className:'cmdb_ci_web_server', values: {name:'apache linux den 200', running_process_command: 'xyz', running_process_key_parameters: 'abc', tcp_port:'3452'}}, {className:'cmdb_ci_linux_server', values: {name:'lnux100', ram:'2048'}}], relations:[{parent: 0, child: 1, type: 'Runs on::Runs'}] }; var input = JSON.stringify(payload); var output = sn_cmdb.IdentificationEngine.createOrUpdateCI('ServiceNow', input); gs.info(JSON.stringify(JSON.parse(output), null, 2));
children.text2: Identify a dependent CI.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations
children.text: No values are currently returned.

children.name: input.items.className
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Class/table name, sys_class_name, of the configuration item (CI) to create or update.

This value can be any CMDB class/table, such as cmdb_ci_linux_server or cmdb_ci_win_server.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var payload = {items: [ {className:'cmdb_ci_netgear', values: {name:'ny8500-nbxs08', ports:'1200'}, lookup: [{className:'cmdb_serial_number', values:{serial_number:'1234ABCD', serial_number_type:'uuid',absent:'false',valid:'true'}}, {className:'cmdb_serial_number', values:{serial_number:'3456EFGH', serial_number_type:'system',absent:'false',valid:'true'}}]}]}; var input = JSON.stringify(payload); var output = sn_cmdb.IdentificationEngine.createOrUpdateCI('ServiceNow', input); gs.info(JSON.stringify(JSON.parse(output), null, 2));
children.text2: Identify an independent CI with lookup-based identification.

children.name: <String>.items
children.text:
List of objects that describe the created or updated CIs.

Data type: Array

"items": { 
  "additionalRelatedItems": [Array],
  "className": "String",
  "duplicateIndices": [Array],
  "errorCount": Number,
  "errors": [Array],
  "identificationAttempts": [Array],
  "identifierEntrySysId": "String",
  "inputIndices": [Array],
  "maskedAttributes": [Array],
  "operation": "String",
  "relatedItems": [Array],
  "relatedSysIds": [Array],
  "sysId": "String",
}

children.name: input.items.internal_id
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique item identifier for the associated payload.

This can be any value, but must be unique within the payload.

children.name: input.items.lookup
children.text: Array

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems
children.text:
List of JSON objects that provides information about additional lookup and related items that were processed but not provided as part of the input payload. These items are from partial payloads.

This information is not currently returned.

Data type: Array

"additionalRelatedItems": [ 
  {
    "className": "String", 
    "inputIndices": [Array], 
    "operation": "String",
    "sysId": "String"
  }
]

children.name: input.items.lookup.className
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Class/table name, sys_class_name, of the configuration item (CI) to create or update.

This value can be any CMDB class/table, such as cmdb_serial_number or cmdb_ci_network_adapter.

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.className
children.text:
Class/table name (sys_class_name) of the CI that was created or updated.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.lookup.internal_id
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique item identifier for the associated payload.

This can be any value, but must be unique within the payload.

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.inputIndices
input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Unique CI identifier for a specific source.
"sys_object_source_info": { 
  "source_feed": "String",
  "source_name": "String",  
  "source_native_key": "String",
  "source_recency_timestamp": "String"
}

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.inputIndices.mainIndex
children.text:
Index value from the request body items array that corresponds to the CI parent of the additional related item.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.inputIndices.subIndex
children.text:
Index value from the request body items.lookup array that corresponds to the additional related item.

Data type: Number

children.name: input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info.source_feed
children.text: String
children.text2:
If the source can have multiple feeds, use this field to provide the name of the feed sending this item.

The data source generates this feed name. It can be any string that uniquely identifies the source feed.

children.name: input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info.source_name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Data source of the CI
              information. This value must be one of the choice values defined for the
              discovery_source field of the Configuration Item [cmdb_ci] table.

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.operation
children.text:
Type of operation.

Possible values:

  • INSERT: New CI was inserted into the database.
  • NO_CHANGE: No CI changes were made.
  • UPDATE: Existing CI was updated.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.sysId
children.text:
Sys_id of the additional related items.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info.source_native_key
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique key/id for the item from the source.

The data source generates this key. It can be any string that is unique to the item.

children.name: <String>.items.className
children.text:
Class/table name (sys_class_name) of the CI that was created or updated.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp
children.text: String
children.text2:
UTC date and time that the item was scanned.

Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

children.name: input.items.lookup.values
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Fields to create or update for this related item as name/value pairs, where the name is the field name. For a reference field, the value must be the referenced sys_id.

Field names and types depend on the fields selected by the user, such as:

"values": {
  "host_name": "String",
  "ip_address": "String",
  "name": "String",
  "os_name": "String",
  "sys_class_name": "String"
}

children.name: <String>.items.duplicateIndices
children.text:
List of indexes of CIs that are duplicates of the current item.

Data type: Array

children.name: <String>.items.errorCount
children.text:
Number of errors.

Data type: Number

children.name: input.items.related
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Reference to the top-level item that contains the related list. Rules in the Related Entry [cmdb_related_entry] define what type of records can be in this array. These records are used to add items based on a related table that has a reference to the CI that is being identified.

The related table may or may not extend cmdb_ci. These records are not used to identify the configuration item.

"related" [
  {
    "className": "String",
    "internal_id": "String",
    "sys_object_source_info": {Object},
    "values": {Object}
  }
]

children.name: input.items.related.className
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Class/table name, sys_class_name, of the configuration item (CI) to create or update.

This value can be any CMDB class/table, such as cmdb_software_instance or cmdb_key_value.

children.name: <String>.items.errors
<String>.items.errors.error
children.text:
Type of error encountered while processing the CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.related.internal_id
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique item identifier for the associated payload.

This can be any value, but must be unique within the payload.

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Unique CI identifier for a specific source.
"sys_object_source_info": { 
  "source_feed": "String",
  "source_name": "String",  
  "source_native_key": "String",
  "source_recency_timestamp": "String"
}

children.name: <String>.items.errors.message
children.text:
Error message associated with the error.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts
children.text:
List of attempts that were made to identify the CIs.

Data type: Array

"identificationAttempts": [
  { 
    "attemptResult": "String", 
    "attributes": [Array],
    "hybridEntryCiAttributes": [Array],
    "identifierName": "String",
    "searchOnTable": "String" 
  }
]

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_feed
children.text: String
children.text2:
If the source can have multiple feeds, use this field to provide the name of the feed sending this item.

The data source generates this feed name. It can be any string that uniquely identifies the source feed.

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.attemptResult
children.text:
Results of the attempt to identify the CI.

Possible values:

  • MATCHED: Identification succeeded. A unique CI was found in the identifier rule table which exactly matched the specified attributes.
  • MULTI_MATCH: Identification failed with an error. Duplicate CIs were found in the identifier rule table when matching against the specified attributes.
  • NO_MATCH: Identification failed. No CI was found in the identifier rule table which matched the specified attributes.
  • SKIPPED: Identification not attempted. The attributes required for this identifier rule table search were not provided, so the rule was not applied.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Data source of the CI
              information. This value must be one of the choice values defined for the
              discovery_source field of the Configuration Item [cmdb_ci] table.

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.attributes
children.text:
List of CI identifier entry attributes that were used during the identification process.

Data type: Array

Attribute names and types depend on the request body data and the identifier in use, such as:

"attributes": [
  "serial_number": "String",
  "serial_number_type": "String",
]

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_native_key
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique key/id for the item from the source.

The data source generates this key. It can be any string that is unique to the item.

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp
children.text: String
children.text2:
UTC date and time that the item was scanned.

Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.hybridEntryCiAttributes
children.text: No values are currently returned.

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.identifierName
children.text:
Identifier rule used for this CI identification attempt.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.related.values
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Fields to create or update for this related item as name/value pairs, where the name is the field name. For a reference field, the value must be the referenced sys_id.

Field names and types depend on the fields selected by the user, such as:

"values": {
  "host_name": "String",
  "ip_address": "String",
  "name": "String",
  "os_name": "String",
  "sys_class_name": "String"
}

children.name: input.items.settings
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Parameters that define the types of updates that are permitted.
"settings": { 
  "skipReclassificationRestrictionRules": Boolean, 
  "updateWithoutDowngrade": Boolean, 
  "updateWithoutSwitch": Boolean,
  "updateWithoutUpgrade": Boolean
}

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.searchOnTable
children.text:
Name of the table searched during the identification process.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.settings.skipReclassificationRestrictionRules
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether IRE should not run the Reclassification Restriction rule that matches the class for the payload item.
Valid values:
  • true: Skip running the rule.
  • false: Run the rule.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.items.identifierEntrySysId
children.text:
Sys_id for the identifier rule used to identify the CI. Located in the Identifier Entry [cmdb_identifier_entry] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.inputIndices
children.text:
Index values for CIs from the request body items array that correspond to this CI.

Data type: Array

children.name: input.items.settings.updateWithoutDowngrade
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether update and downgrade are both permitted for this item.
Valid values:
  • true: Update the item but downgrade is not permitted.
  • false: Both item update and downgrade are permitted.

Default: false

children.name: input.items.settings.updateWithoutUpgrade
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether update and upgrade are both permitted for this item.
Valid values:
  • true: Update the item but upgrade is not permitted.
  • false: Both item update and upgrade are permitted.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.items.maskedAttributes
children.text:
List of attributes whose update by a non-authoritative data source was skipped as defined by the Reconciliation Rules.

Data type: Array

children.name: input.items.settings.updateWithoutSwitch
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether the item can be updated and the class switched.
Valid values:
  • true: Update the item but class switching is not permitted.
  • false: Both item update and class switching are permitted.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems
children.text:
List of JSON objects that provides information about the processed related items.

Data type: Array

"relatedItems": [
  { 
    "className": "String",
    "errors": [Array],
    "errorCount": Number, 
    "inputIndices": [Array],
    "operation": "String",
    "sysId": "String"
  }
]

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Unique CI identifier for a specific source.
"sys_object_source_info": { 
  "source_feed": "String",
  "source_name": "String",

  "source_recency_timestamp": "String"
}

If the source can have multiple feeds, use this field to provide the name of the feed sending this item.

children.text: String
children.text2:
Data source of the CI
              information. This value must be one of the choice values defined for the

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.errorCount
children.text:
Number of errors detected during processing.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.inputIndices
input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_native_key
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique key/id for the item from the source.

The data source generates this key. It can be any string that is unique to the item.

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp
children.text: String
children.text2:
UTC date and time that the item was scanned.

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.inputIndices.mainIndex
children.text:
Integer value from the request body items array that corresponds to the CI parent of the related item.

Data type: Number

children.name: input.items.values
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Fields to create or update for this related item as name/value pairs, where the name is the field name. For a reference field, the value must be the referenced sys_id.

Field names and types depend on the fields selected by the user, such as:

"values": {
  "host_name": "String",
  "ip_address": "String",
  "name": "String",
  "os_name": "String",
  "sys_class_name": "String"
}

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.inputIndices.subIndex
children.text:
Integer value from the request body items.lookup array that corresponds to the related item.

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.operation
children.text:
Type of operation.

Possible values:

  • INSERT: New CI was inserted into the database.
  • NO_CHANGE: No CI changes were made.
  • UPDATE: Existing CI was updated.

Data type: String

children.name: input.referenceItems
children.text: Array

children.name: <String>.items.relatedSysIds
children.text:
List of the sys_id values for related items (table lookup items) from the request body items.lookup array.
Notable values:
  • null: No sys_id was identified for this related item.

Data type: Array

children.name: input.referenceItems.referenced
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id defined for the item being referenced by another item.

children.name: input.referenceItems.referencedBy
children.text: String

children.text:
Sys_id of the CI that was updated or created.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.relations
children.text:
List of JSON objects that provides information about the processed relations.

Data type: Array

"relations":[
  { 
    "className": "String",
    "errorCount": Number,
    "inputIndices": [Array],
    "operation": "String",
    "sysId": "String" 
  }
]

children.name: input.referenceItems.referenceField
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the reference field in the class/table for the referencedBy item.

children.name: <String>.relations.className
children.text:
Sys_class_name of this dependent relationship CI.
Only supported value:
  • cmdb_rel_ci: The CI Relationship table.

Data type: String

children.name: input.relations
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Array of objects that specify relationships between items in the input payload.
An object in this array can use either of two formats.
  • The object can define a relationship between two top-level items (only) using parent and child name-value pairs, with values representing item indexes from the payload items array.
  • The object can define a relationship between any two items, including top-level, related, or lookup items, using parent_id and child_id key/value pairs, with values representing internal_id values defined for those items.
"relations": [
  {
    "child": Number,
    "parent": Number,
    "type": "String"
  }
]
"relations": [
  {
    "child_id": "String",
    "parent_id": "String",
    "type": "String"
  }
]

children.name: input.relations.child
children.text: Number
children.text2: Integer index of the CI object in the items array that represents the child in the relationship.

children.name: <String>.relations.errorCount
children.text:
Number of errors.

Data type: Number

children.name: input.relations.child_id
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id of the child item in the relation.

children.name: <String>.relations.inputIndices
children.text:
Indexes of the corresponding input relations.

Data type: Array

children.name: <String>.relations.operation
children.text:
Type of operation performed.

Possible values:

  • INSERT
  • UPDATE
  • NO_CHANGE

Data type: String

children.name: input.relations.parent
children.text: Number
children.text2: Integer index of the parent item in the items array.

children.name: input.relations.parent_id
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id of the parent item in the relation (item.related or item.lookup item).

children.name: <String>.relations.sysId
children.text:
Sys_id of the dependent relationship CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.relations.type
children.text: String
children.text2:
The type of relationship that exists between the parent
              and child items. This must be a name field value from the CI Relationship Type
              [cmdb_rel_type] table.

children.name: source
children.text: String
children.text2:
Identifies the data source of the CI information. This value must be one of the
                choice values defined for the discovery_source field of the cmdb_ci table.

children.name: input.items
children.text: Array

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems
children.text:
List of CIs that were committed during the IRE processing of the current payload, but were not present in the current input payload.

Data type: Array

"additionalCommittedItems": [
  {
    "className": "String",
    "errorCount": Number,
    "operation": "String",
    "identificationAttempts": [Array],
    "inputIndices": [Array],
    "markers": [Array],
    "mergedPayloads": [Array],
    "sysId": "String"
  }
]

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.className
children.text:
Sys_class_name of this additional CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.className
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Class/table name, sys_class_name, of the configuration item (CI) to create or update.

This value can be any CMDB class/table, such as cmdb_ci_linux_server or cmdb_ci_win_server.

children.name: input.items.internal_id
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique item identifier for the associated payload.

This can be any value, but must be unique within the payload.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.errorCount
children.text:
Number of errors encountered while processing this additional CI.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.errors
input.items.lookup
children.text: Array

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.errors.error
children.text:
Type of error encountered while processing the additional CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.lookup.className
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Class/table name, sys_class_name, of the configuration item (CI) to create or update.

This value can be any CMDB class/table, such as cmdb_serial_number or cmdb_ci_network_adapter.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.errors.message
children.text:
Error message encountered while processing the additional CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.lookup.internal_id
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique lookup item identifier for the associated payload.

This can be any value, but must be unique within the payload.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.identificationAttempts
children.text:
Array of objects in which each object describes an attempt made to identify this additional CI.
Data type: Array
"identificationAttempts": [
  {
    "attemptResult": "String",
    "attributes": [Array],
    "hybridEntryCiAttributes": [Array],
    "identiferName": "String",
    "searchOnTable": [Array]
  }
]

children.name: input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Defines a unique CI identifier for a specific data source. Different sources may have different name-value pairs for the same CI.
"sys_object_source_info": { 
  "source_feed": "String",
  "source_name": "String",  
  "source_native_key": "String",
  "source_recency_timestamp": "String"
}

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.identificationAttempts.attemptResult
children.text:
Outcome of this additional CI identification attempt.

Data type: String

Possible values:
  • MATCHED: Identification succeeded. A unique CI was found in the identifier rule table which exactly matched the specified attributes.
  • MULTI_MATCH: Identification failed with an error. Duplicate CIs were found in the identifier rule table when matching against the specified attributes.
  • NO_MATCH: Identification failed. No CI was found in the identifier rule table which matched the specified attributes.
  • SKIPPED: Identification not attempted. The attributes required for this identifier rule table search were not provided, so the rule was not applied.

children.name: input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info.source_feed
children.text: String
children.text2:
If the source can have multiple feeds, use this field to provide the name of the feed sending this item.

The data source generates this feed name. It can be any string that uniquely identifies the source feed.

children.name: input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info.source_name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Data source of the CI information. This value must be one of the choice values
              defined for the discovery_source field of the Configuration Item [cmdb_ci] table.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.identificationAttempts.attributes
children.text:
Array of CI identifier entry attributes used during this additional CI identification attempt.

Data type: Array

Attribute names and types depend on the request body data and the identifier in use, such as:

"attributes": [
  "serial_number": "String",
  "serial_number_type": "String",
]

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.identificationAttempts.hybridEntryCiAttributes
children.text:
Array of CI identifier entry attributes used during this additional CI identification attempt.

Data type: Array

Attribute names and types depend on the request body data and the identifier in use, such as:

"hybridEntryCiAttributes": [
  "name": "String",
  "serial_number": "String"
]

children.name: input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info.source_native_key
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique key-id for the item from the source.

The data source generates this key. It can be any string that is unique to the item.

children.name: input.items.lookup.sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp
children.text: String
children.text2:
UTC date/time that the item was scanned.

Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.identificationAttempts.identifierName
children.text:
Identifier rule used for this additional CI identification attempt.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.identificationAttempts.searchOnTable
children.text:
Name of the table searched for this additional CI identification attempt.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.lookup.values
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Field information for the CI as name-value pairs, where the name is the field name. When updating reference fields, the value must be the referenced sys_id.

Field names and types depend on the fields selected by the user, such as:

"values": {
  "serial_number": "String",
  "serial_number_type": "String",
  "valid": "String",
  "ip_address": "String",
  "mac_address": "String"
}

children.name: input.items.related
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Reference to the top-level item that contains the related list. Rules in the Related Entry [cmdb_related_entry] define what type of records can be in this array. These records are used to add items based on a related table that has a reference to the CI that is being identified.

The related table may or may not extend cmdb_ci. These records are not used to identify the configuration item.

"related" [
  {
    "className": "String",
    "internal_id": "String",
    "sys_object_source_info": {Object},
    "values": {Object}
  }
]

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.identifierEntrySysId
children.text:
Sys_id for the identifier rule used to identify this additional CI.
Notable values:
  • Unknown: Identification of this additional CI failed. See errors for details.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.inputIndices
input.items.related.className
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Class/table name, sys_class_name, of the configuration item (CI) to create or update.

This value can be any CMDB class/table, such as cmdb_software_instance or cmdb_key_value.

children.name: input.items.related.internal_id
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique identifier for this related item in this payload. Can be any value, but
              must be unique within the payload.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.markers
children.text:
Array of marker values for internal use.

Data type: Array

"markers": []

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.mergedPayloads
children.text:
Array of sys_id values for partial payloads from the CMDB IRE Partial Payloads [cmdb_ire_partial_payloads] table that were merged during processing of this additional CI.

Data type: Array

"mergedPayloadIds": [
  "String"
]

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Object that makes up a unique CI identifier for a specified data source. Different sources may have different name-value pairs for the same CI.
"sys_object_source_info": { 
  "source_feed": "String",
  "source_name": "String",  
  "source_native_key": "String",
  "source_recency_timestamp": "String"
}

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_feed
children.text: String
children.text2:
If the source can have multiple feeds, use this field to provide the name of the feed sending this item.

The data source generates this feed name. It can be any string that uniquely identifies the source feed.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.operation
children.text:
Operation performed for this additional CI.

Data type: String

Possible values:
  • DELETE: An existing CI is removed from the target table.
  • INSERT: The additional CI is inserted into the target table as a new record.
  • NO_CHANGE: No operation is performed for the additional CI.
  • UPDATE: An existing CI in the target table is updated.
  • UPDATE_WITH_DOWNGRADE: An existing CI in the target table is updated and its class is changed to a more generic class (ancestor class).
  • UPDATE_WITH_SWITCH: An existing CI in the target table is updated and its class is changed to another class which is not an ancestor or descendent class.
  • UPDATE_WITH_UPGRADE: An existing CI in the target table is updated and its class is changed to a more specialized class (descendent class).

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Identifies the data source of the CI information. This value must be one of the
              choice values defined for the discovery_source field of the Configuration Item
              [cmdb_ci] table.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.sysId
children.text:
The sys_id found for this additional CI through identification.

Data type: String

Notable values:
  • Unknown: Identification of this additional CI failed. See errors for details.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.warnings
input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_native_key
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique key/ID from the source for the related item.

The data source generates this key. It can be any string that is unique to the item.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.warnings.error
children.text:
Type of warning encountered while processing this additional CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp
children.text: String
children.text2:
UTC date and time that the item was scanned.

Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedItems.warnings.message
children.text:
Warning message encountered while processing this additional CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.related.values
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Fields to create or update for this related item as name/value pairs, where the name is the field name. For a reference field, the value must be the referenced sys_id.

Field names and types depend on the fields selected by the user, such as:

"values": {
  "host_name": "String",
  "ip_address": "String",
  "name": "String",
  "os_name": "String",
  "sys_class_name": "String"
}

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations
children.text:
Array of objects that describe a dependent relationship CI that was not included in the request body relations list to insert or update.

Data type: Array

"additionalCommittedRelations": [
  {
    "className": "String",
    "inputIndices": [Array],
    "markers": [Array],
    "mergedPayloadIds": [Array],
    "operation": "String"
  }
]

children.name: input.items.settings
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Parameters that define the types of updates that are permitted.
"settings": { 
  "skipReclassificationRestrictionRules": Boolean, 
  "updateWithoutDowngrade": Boolean, 
  "updateWithoutSwitch": Boolean,
  "updateWithoutUpgrade": Boolean
}

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations.className
children.text:
Sys_class_name of this additional dependent relationship CI.

Data type: String

Only supported value:
  • cmdb_rel_ci: The CI Relationship table.

children.name: input.items.settings.skipReclassificationRestrictionRules
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether IRE should not run the Reclassification Restriction rule that matches the class for the payload item.
Valid values:
  • true: Skip running the rule.
  • false: Run the rule.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations.errorCount
children.text:
Number of errors encountered while processing this additional dependent relationship CI.

Data type: Number

children.name: input.items.settings.updateWithoutDowngrade
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether update and downgrade are both permitted for this item.
Valid values:
  • true: Update the item but downgrade is not permitted.
  • false: Both item update and downgrade are permitted.

Default: false

children.name: input.items.settings.updateWithoutSwitch
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether the item can be updated and the class switched.
Valid values:
  • true: Update the item but class switching is not permitted.
  • false: Both item update and class switching are permitted.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations.errors
input.items.settings.updateWithoutUpgrade
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether update and upgrade are both permitted for this item.
Valid values:
  • true: Update the item but upgrade is not permitted.
  • false: Both item update and upgrade are permitted.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations.errors.error
children.text:
Type of error encountered while processing the additional dependent relationship CI.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations.errors.message
children.text:
Error message encountered while processing this additional dependent relationship CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Unique CI identifier for a specific source.
"sys_object_source_info": { 
  "source_feed": "String",
  "source_name": "String",  
  "source_native_key": "String",
  "source_recency_timestamp": "String"
}

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_feed
children.text: String
children.text2:
If the source can have multiple feeds, use this field to provide the name of the feed sending this item.

The data source generates this feed name. It can be any string that uniquely identifies the source feed.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations.inputIndices
children.text:
Index values for dependent relationship CI objects in the request body relations array that correspond to this additional dependent relationship CI.

Data type: Array

"inputIndices": [
  Number
]

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Data source of the CI
              information. This value must be one of the choice values defined for the
              discovery_source field of the Configuration Item [cmdb_ci] table.

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations.markers
children.text:
Marker values for internal use.

Data type: Array

"markers": []

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations.mergedPayloadIds
children.text:
Sys_id values for partial payloads from the CMDB IRE Partial Payloads [cmdb_ire_partial_payloads] table that were merged for this CI.that were merged during processing of this additional dependent relationship CI.

Data type: Array

"mergedPayloadIds": [
  "String"
]

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_native_key
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique key/id for the item from the source.

The data source generates this key. It can be any string that is unique to the item.

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp
children.text: String
children.text2:
UTC date and time that the item was scanned.

Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

children.name: <String>.additionalCommittedRelations.operation
children.text:
Operation that was performed for the additional dependent relationship CI.
Possible values:
  • INSERT: The dependent relationship CI is inserted into the target table as a new record.
  • INSERT_AS_INCOMPLETE: The dependent relationship CI had errors and is inserted into the CMDB IRE Incomplete Payloads [cmdb_ire_incomplete_payloads] table.
  • INSERT_AS_PARTIAL: The dependent relationship CI had errors and is inserted into the CMDB IRE Partial Payloads [cmdb_ire_partial_payloads] table.
  • NO_CHANGE: No operation is performed for the dependent relationship CI.
  • UPDATE: An existing dependent relationship CI in the target table is updated.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.hasError
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether any item or relation has errors.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: input.items.values
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Fields to create or update for this related item as name/value pairs, where the name is the field name. For a reference field, the value must be the referenced sys_id.

Field names and types depend on the fields selected by the user, such as:

"values": {
  "host_name": "String",
  "ip_address": "String",
  "name": "String",
  "os_name": "String",
  "sys_class_name": "String"
}

children.name: <String>.hasWarning
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether any item or relation has warnings.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: input.referenceItems
children.text: Array

children.name: <String>.items
children.text:
Array of objects that describe the created or updated CIs.

Data type: Array

"items": [
  {  
    "additionalRelatedItems": [Array],
    "className": "String",
    "duplicateIndices": [Array],
    "errorCount": Number, 
    "errors": [Array], 
    "identificationAttempts": [Array], 
    "identifierEntrySysId": "String",  
    "incompleteSysIds": "String",
    "inputIndices": [Array], 
    "maskedAttributes": [Array],
    "operation": "String", 
    "partialSysIds": "String", 
    "relatedItems": [Array], 
    "relatedSysIds": [Array], 
    "sysId": "String" 
  }
]

children.name: input.referenceItems.referenced
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id defined for the item being referenced by another item.

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems
children.text:
List of JSON objects that provide information about additional lookup and related items that were processed but not provided as part of the input payload. These items are from partial payloads.

Data type: Array

"additionalRelatedItems": [ 
  {
    "className": "String", 
    "inputIndices": [Array],
    "mergedPayloadIds": [Array], 
    "operation": "String",
    "sysId": "String"
  }
]

children.name: input.referenceItems.referencedBy
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id defined for the item that references another item.

children.name: input.referenceItems.referenceField
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the reference field in the class/table for the referencedBy item.

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.className
children.text:
Class/table name (sys_class_name) of the CI that was created or updated.

Data type: String

children.name: input.relations
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Array of objects that specify relationships between items in the input payload.
An object in this array can use either of two formats.
  • The object can define a relationship between two top-level items (only) using parent and child name-value pairs, with values representing item indexes from the payload items array.
  • The object can define a relationship between any two items, including top-level, related, or lookup items, using parent_id and child_id key/value pairs, with values representing internal_id values defined for those items.
"relations": [
  {
    "child": Number,
    "parent": Number,
    "type": "String"
  }
]
"relations": [
  {
    "child_id": "String",
    "parent_id": "String",
    "type": "String"
  }
]

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.inputIndices
children.text:
Index values for CIs from the request body items array that correspond to this related item.

Data type: Array of Numbers

children.name: input.relations.child
children.text: Number
children.text2: Integer index of the CI object in the items array that represents the child in the relationship.

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.mergedPayloadIds
children.text:
List of sys_ids of the partial payloads that were merged into the related item. Located in the CMDB IRE Partial Payloads [cmdb_ire_partial_payloads] table.

Data type: Array

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.operation
children.text:
Type of operation.

Possible values:

  • INSERT: New CI was inserted into the database.
  • NO_CHANGE: No CI changes were made.
  • UPDATE: Existing CI was updated.

Data type: String

children.name: input.relations.child_id
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id of the child item in the relation.

children.name: input.relations.parent
children.text: Number
children.text2: Integer index of the parent item in the items array.

children.name: <String>.items.additionalRelatedItems.sysId
children.text:
Sys_id of the CI that was updated or created.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.className
children.text:
Class/table name (sys_class_name) of the CI that was created or updated.

Data type: String

children.name: input.relations.parent_id
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id of the parent item in the relation (item.related or item.lookup item).

children.name: input.relations.type
children.text: String
children.text2:
The type of relationship that exists between the parent
              and child items. This must be a name field value from the CI Relationship Type
              [cmdb_rel_type] table.

children.name: <String>.items.duplicateIndices
children.text:
List of indexes of CIs that are duplicates of the current item.

Data type: Array

children.name: <String>.items.errorCount
children.text:
Number of errors encountered while processing the item.

Data type: Number

children.name: options
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Optional, but {} or null must be passed-in. Options to enable or disable features.
Note: By default or if partial_payloads is set to true, both partial_commits and deduplicate_payloads are enabled, even if they are set to false, as those features are essential for partial payloads functionality.
"options": { 
 "deduplicate_payloads": "Boolean",
 "generate_summary": "Boolean", 
 "partial_commits": "Boolean", 
 "partial_payloads": "Boolean"
}

children.name: <String>.items.errors
options.deduplicate_payloads
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether duplicate items are merged or considered errors.

Valid values:

  • true: Merge duplicate items.
  • false: Consider duplicate items as errors.

Default: true

children.name: <String>.items.errors.error
children.text:
Type of error encountered while processing the CI.

Data type: String

children.name: options.generate_summary
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether the returned results contain summary information. For the details of the returned summary information, see <String>.summary in the return results table.

Valid values:

  • true: Include summary information.
  • false: Do not include summary information.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.items.errors.message
children.text:
Error message associated with the error.

Data type: String

children.name: options.partial_commits
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether partial commit support is enabled. For additional information on partial commits, see Enhanced IRE features.

Valid values:

  • true: Partial commit enabled.
  • false: Partial commit disabled.

Default: true

children.name: options.partial_payloads
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether partial payload support is enabled. For additional information on partial payloads, see Enhanced IRE features and Create an IRE data source rule.

Valid values:

  • true: Partial payload enabled.
  • false: Partial payload disabled.

Default: true

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts
children.text:
List of attempts that were made to identify the CIs.

Data type: Array

"identificationAttempts": [
  { 
    "attemptResult": "String", 
    "attributes": [Array],
    "hybridEntryCiAttributes": [Array],
    "identifierName": "String",
    "searchOnTable": "String" 
  }
]

children.name: source
children.text: String
children.text2:
Data source of the CI information. This value must be one of
              the choice values defined for the discovery_source field of the Configuration Item
              [cmdb_ci] table.

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.attemptResult
children.text:
Results of the attempt to identify the CI.

Possible values:

  • MATCHED: Identification succeeded. A unique CI was found in the identifier rule table which exactly matched the specified attributes.
  • MULTI_MATCH: Identification failed with an error. Duplicate CIs were found in the identifier rule table when matching against the specified attributes.
  • NO_MATCH: Identification failed. No CI was found in the identifier rule table which matched the specified attributes.
  • SKIPPED: Identification not attempted. The attributes required for this identifier rule table search were not provided, so the rule was not applied.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.attributes
children.text:
List of CI identifier entry attributes that were used during the identification process.

Data type: Array

Attribute names and types depend on the request body data and the identifier in use, such as:

"attributes": [
  "serial_number": "String",
  "serial_number_type": "String",
]

children.name: <String>items.identificationAttempts.hybridEntryCiAttributes
children.text:
List of CI identifier entry attributes that were used during the identification process.

Data type: Array

Attribute names and types depend on the request body data and the identifier in use, such as:

"hybridEntryCiAttributes": [
  "name": "String",
  "serial_number": "String"
]

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.identifierName
children.text:
Identifier rule used for this CI identification attempt.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.searchOnTable
children.text:
Name of the table searched during the identification process.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.identifierEntrySysId
children.text:
Sys_id for the identifier rule used to identify the CI. Located in the Identifier Entry [cmdb_identifier_entry] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.incompleteSysIds
children.text:
If the item had errors and was saved as an incomplete payload, this parameter contains the sys_id of the record in the CMDB IRE Incomplete Payloads [cmdb_ire_incomplete_payloads] table.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.inputIndices
children.text:
Indexes of the corresponding input CI. For top-level items, it is a list of integers. For related or lookup CIs, it is list of JSON objects.

Data type: Array of Numbers

children.name: <String>.items.maskedAttributes
children.text:
List of attributes whose update by a non-authoritative data source was skipped as defined by the Reconciliation Rules.

Data type: Array

children.name: <String>.items.operation
children.text:
Operation that took place.

Possible values:

  • INSERT: New CI was inserted into the database.
  • INSERT_AS_INCOMPLETE: Item was saved in cmdb_ire_incomplete_payloads table.
  • INSERT_AS_PARTIAL: Item was saved in cmdb_ire_partial_payloads table.
  • NO_CHANGE: No CI changes were made.
  • UPDATE: Existing CI was updated.
  • UPDATE_WITH_DOWNGRADE: CI was updated and the class changed to a more generic class (ancestor class).
  • UPDATE_WITH_SWITCH: CI was updated and the class changed to a class that is not ancestor or descendent.
  • UPDATE_WITH_UPDRADE: CI was updated and the class changed to a more specialized class (descendent class).

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.partialSysIds
children.text:
If the item had errors and was saved as a partial payload, this parameter contains the sys_id of the partial payload record.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.operation
children.text:
Operation that took place.

Possible values:

  • INSERT: New related CI was inserted into the database.
  • INSERT_AS_INCOMPLETE: Item was saved in cmdb_ire_incomplete_payloads table.
  • INSERT_AS_PARTIAL: Item was saved in cmdb_ire_partial_payloads table.
  • NO_CHANGE: No related CI changes were made.
  • UPDATE: Existing related CI was updated.
  • UPDATE_WITH_DOWNGRADE: Related CI was updated and the class changed to a more generic class (ancestor class).
  • UPDATE_WITH_SWITCH: Related CI was updated and the class changed to a class that is not ancestor or descendent.
  • UPDATE_WITH_UPDRADE: Related CI was updated and the class changed to a more specialized class (descendent class).

Data type: String

children.name: createOrUpdateCIEnhanced(String source, String input, Object options)
children.text: Inserts or updates configuration items and non-Configuration Management Database (CMDB) configuration items (classes not extending from cmdb_ci) in the CMDB based on identification and reconciliation rules. Use this API instead of updating the CMDB directly.
children.text2:
In addition to providing the functionality of the createOrUpdateCI() method, this method also supports:

  • Handling partial payloads
  • Handling partial commits
  • Removing duplicate items within a payload
  • Generating output summaries

For additional information on IRE and more detailed explanations of the data used by this method, see Identification and Reconciliation (IRE).

children.name: jsonString
children.text: String
children.text2:
A JSON formatted string of configuration items to be added or updated. Each input string is in the format Â 'items: [{}], relations:[{}]', where each item within the items and relations lists contains name-value pairs.
The possible name-value pairs within the items list are:
  • className - the sys_class_name of the CI to be created or updated.
  • values:{} - the field information for the CI as name-value pairs, where the name is the field name.
  • lookup:[{}] - a list of records with each item having name-value pairs like the items list.
The possible name-value pairs within the relations list are:
  • parent - index of the parent item in the dependency relation
  • child - index of the child item in the dependency relation
  • type - the relationship type. This is one of the name field values from the cmdb_rel_type table.

children.name: String
children.text:
A JSON formatted string that is a list of results. Each result string is in the format Â 'items: [{}], relations:[{}]', where each item within the items and relations lists contains name-value pairs.
The possible name-value pairs within the items list are:
  • className- the sys_class_name for the CI that was updated or created.
  • operation, which is one of INSERT, UPDATE, UPDATE_WITH_UPGRADE, UPDATE_WITH_DOWNGRADE, UPDATE_WITH_SWITCH, DELETE, NO_CHANGE
  • sysId - the sys_id of the CI that was updated or created.
  • relatedSysIds - a list of sys_id values of CIs used during lookup based identification.
  • identifierEntrySysId - sys_id of identifier entry used during matching.
  • errors - a list of errors in the format of (error, message string)
  • duplicateIndices - a list of indexes of items that are duplicates of the current item.
  • identificationAttempts - a list of attempts in the format of (attributes, identiferName, attemptResult, searchOnTable) where
    • attributes - the attributes of identifier entry used during identification
    • identiferName - the CI identifier to which this identifier entry belongs
    • attemptResult - one of SKIPPED, NO_MATCH, MATCHED, MULTI_MATCH
    • searchOnTable - the table searched during the identification process.
The possible name-value pairs within the relations list are:
  • className - the relationship CI's class name and is always cmdb_rel_ci
  • operation - one of INSERT, UPDATE, NO_CHANGE
  • sysId - the sys_id of the relationship CI inserted or updated

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var payload = { "items": [ { "className": "cmdb_ci_win_server", "values": { "short_description": "Linux server description", "name": "Linux Server 1" } } ] }; var input = JSON.stringify(payload); var output = sn_cmdb.IdentificationEngine.identifyCI(input); gs.info(JSON.stringify(JSON.parse(output), null, 2));
children.text2: The following shows how to reclassify a configuration item.

children.name: identifyCI(String jsonString)
children.text:
Determines the operation (insert/update) to perform with the specified payload without
    committing the operation in the database.
children.text2: This works just like createOrUpdateCI(), but does not commit the result.

children.name: input
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Input payload. A JSON formatted string of configuration items to add or update. 
"input" { 
 "items": [Array],
 "referenceItems": [Array],
 "relations": [Array]
}

children.name: <String>
children.text:
JSON formatted string that is a list of results for the configuration items in the input string.

Data type: String

{ 
  "additionalCommittedItems": [Array],  
  "additionalCommittedRelations": [Array], 
  "hasError": "Boolean", 
  "hasWarning": "Boolean",
  "items": [Array],  
  "relations": [Array], 
  "summary": {Object} 
}

]

"items": [

Data source of the CI information. This value must be one of the choice values

List of sys_ids of the partial payloads that were merged into the related item. Located in the CMDB IRE Partial Payloads [cmdb_ire_partial_payloads] table.

children.text: String

Unique key-id for the item from the source.

children.text: Object

Field information for the CI as name-value pairs, where the name is the field name. When updating reference fields, the value must be the referenced sys_id.

Field names and types depend on the fields selected by the user, such as:

  "serial_number": "String",

  "valid": "String",

List of indexes of CIs that are duplicates of the current item.

children.name: input.items.related
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Reference to the top-level item that contains the related list. Rules in the Related Entry [cmdb_related_entry] define what type of records can be in this array. These records are used to add items based on a related table that has a reference to the CI that is being identified.

The related table may or may not extend cmdb_ci. These records are not used to identify the configuration item.

"related" [
  {
    "className": "String",
    "internal_id": "String",
    "sys_object_source_info": {Object},
    "values": {Object}
  }
]

children.name: input.items.related.className
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Class/table name, sys_class_name, of the configuration item (CI) to create or update.

This value can be any CMDB class/table, such as cmdb_software_instance or cmdb_key_value.

Number of errors encountered while processing the item.

Unique identifier for this related item in this payload. Can be any value, but
              must be unique within the payload.

children.text: Object
children.text2:
Object that makes up a unique CI identifier for a specified data source. Different sources may have different name-value pairs for the same CI.
"sys_object_source_info": { 
  "source_feed": "String",
  "source_name": "String",  
  "source_native_key": "String",
  "source_recency_timestamp": "String"
}

children.name: <String>.items.errors.error
children.text:
Type of error encountered while processing the CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_feed
children.text: String
children.text2:
If the source can have multiple feeds, use this field to provide the name of the feed sending this item.

The data source generates this feed name. It can be any string that uniquely identifies the source feed.

children.name: <String>.items.errors.message
children.text:
The error message encountered while processing the CI.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Identifies the data source of the CI information. This value must be one of the
              choice values defined for the discovery_source field of the Configuration Item
              [cmdb_ci] table.

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts
children.text:
List of attempts that were made to identify the CIs.

Data type: Array

"identificationAttempts": [
  { 
    "attemptResult": "String", 
    "attributes": [Array],
    "hybridEntryCiAttributes": [Array],
    "identifierName": "String",
    "searchOnTable": "String" 
  }
]

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_native_key
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique key/id from the source for the related item.

The data source generates this key. It can be any string that is unique to the item.

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.attemptResult
children.text:
Results of the attempt to identify the CI.

Possible values:

  • MATCHED: Identification succeeded. A unique CI was found in the identifier rule table which exactly matched the specified attributes.
  • MULTI_MATCH: Identification failed with an error. Duplicate CIs were found in the identifier rule table when matching against the specified attributes.
  • NO_MATCH: Identification failed. No CI was found in the identifier rule table which matched the specified attributes.
  • SKIPPED: Identification not attempted. The attributes required for this identifier rule table search were not provided, so the rule was not applied.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.attributes
children.text:
List of CI identifier entry attributes that were used during the identification process.

Data type: Array

Attribute names and types depend on the request body data and the identifier in use, such as:

"attributes": [
  "serial_number": "String",
  "serial_number_type": "String",
]

children.name: input.items.related.sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp
children.text: String
children.text2:
UTC date and time that the item was scanned.

Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.identifierName
children.text:
Identifier rule used for this CI identification attempt.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.related.values
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Fields to create or update for this related item as name/value pairs, where the name is the field name. For a reference field, the value must be the referenced sys_id.

Field names and types depend on the fields selected by the user, such as:

"values": {
  "host_name": "String",
  "ip_address": "String",
  "name": "String",
  "os_name": "String",
  "sys_class_name": "String"
}

children.name: input.items.settings
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Parameters that define the types of updates that are permitted.
"settings": { 
  "skipReclassificationRestrictionRules": Boolean, 
  "updateWithoutDowngrade": Boolean, 
  "updateWithoutSwitch": Boolean,
  "updateWithoutUpgrade": Boolean
}

children.name: <String>.items.identificationAttempts.searchOnTable
children.text:
Name of the table searched during the identification process.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.identifierEntrySysId
children.text:
Sys_id for the identifier rule used to identify the CI. Located in the Identifier Entry [cmdb_identifier_entry] table.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.settings.skipReclassificationRestrictionRules
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether IRE should not run the Reclassification Restriction rule that matches the class for the payload item.
Valid values:
  • true: Skip running the rule.
  • false: Run the rule.

Default: false

children.name: input.items.settings.updateWithoutDowngrade
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether update and downgrade are both permitted for this item.
Valid values:
  • true: Update the item but downgrade is not permitted.
  • false: Both item update and downgrade are permitted.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.items.inputIndices
children.text:
Indexes of the corresponding input CI. For top-level items, it is a list of integers. For related or lookup CIs, it is list of JSON objects.

Data type: Array of Numbers

children.name: input.items.settings.updateWithoutSwitch
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether the item can be updated and the class switched.
Valid values:
  • true: Update the item but class switching is not permitted.
  • false: Both item update and class switching are permitted.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.items.maskedAttributes
children.text:
List of attributes whose update by a non-authoritative data source was skipped as defined by the Reconciliation Rules.

Data type: Array

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Unique CI identifier for a specific source.
"sys_object_source_info": { 
  "source_feed": "String",
  "source_name": "String",  
  "source_native_key": "String",
  "source_recency_timestamp": "String"
}

children.name: input.items.settings.updateWithoutUpgrade
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether update and upgrade are both permitted for this item.
Valid values:
  • true: Update the item but upgrade is not permitted.
  • false: Both item update and upgrade are permitted.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.items.operation
children.text:
Operation that took place.

Possible values:

  • INSERT: New CI was inserted into the database.
  • INSERT_AS_INCOMPLETE: Item was saved in cmdb_ire_incomplete_payloads table.
  • INSERT_AS_PARTIAL: Item was saved in cmdb_ire_partial_payloads table.
  • NO_CHANGE: No CI changes were made.
  • UPDATE: Existing CI was updated.
  • UPDATE_WITH_DOWNGRADE: CI was updated and the class changed to a more generic class (ancestor class).
  • UPDATE_WITH_SWITCH: CI was updated and the class changed to a class that is not ancestor or descendent.
  • UPDATE_WITH_UPDRADE: CI was updated and the class changed to a more specialized class (descendent class).

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems
children.text:
List of JSON objects that provide information about the processed related items.

Data type: Array

"relatedItems": [
  { 
    "className": "String",
    "errorCount": Number,
    "errors": [Array],
    "inputIndices": [Array],
    "mergePayloadIds": [Array],
    "operation": "String",
    "sysId": "String",
    "warningCount": Number,
    "warnings": [Array]
  }
]

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_feed
children.text: String
children.text2:
If the source can have multiple feeds, use this field to provide the name of the feed sending this item.

The data source generates this feed name. It can be any string that uniquely identifies the source feed.

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Data source of the CI
              information. This value must be one of the choice values defined for the
              discovery_source field of the Configuration Item [cmdb_ci] table.

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.className
children.text:
Class/table name (sys_class_name) of the related item.

Data type: String

children.name: input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_native_key
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique key/id for the item from the source.

The data source generates this key. It can be any string that is unique to the item.

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.errorCount
children.text:
Number of errors detected while processing the related items.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.errors
input.items.sys_object_source_info.source_recency_timestamp
children.text: String
children.text2:
UTC date and time that the item was scanned.

Format: YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss

children.name: input.items.values
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Fields to create or update for this related item as name/value pairs, where the name is the field name. For a reference field, the value must be the referenced sys_id.

Field names and types depend on the fields selected by the user, such as:

"values": {
  "host_name": "String",
  "ip_address": "String",
  "name": "String",
  "os_name": "String",
  "sys_class_name": "String"
}

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.errors.error
children.text:
Type of error encountered while processing the related item.

Data type: String

children.name: input.referenceItems
children.text: Array

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.errors.message
children.text:
The error message encountered while processing the related item.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.inputIndices
input.referenceItems.referenced
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id defined for the item being referenced by another item.

children.name: input.referenceItems.referencedBy
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id defined for the item that references another item.

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.inputIndices.mainIndex
children.text:
Index value from the request body items array that corresponds to the CI parent of the related item.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.inputIndices.subIndex
children.text:
Index value from the request body items.lookup array that corresponds to the related item.

Data type: Number

children.name: input.referenceItems.referenceField
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the reference field in the class/table for the referencedBy item.

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.mergedPayloadIds
children.text:
List of sys_ids of the partial payloads that were merged into the CI during processing.

Data type: Array

children.name: input.relations
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Array of objects that specify relationships between items in the input payload.
An object in this array can use either of two formats.
  • The object can define a relationship between two top-level items (only) using parent and child name-value pairs, with values representing item indexes from the payload items array.
  • The object can define a relationship between any two items, including top-level, related, or lookup items, using parent_id and child_id key/value pairs, with values representing internal_id values defined for those items.
"relations": [
  {
    "child": Number,
    "parent": Number,
    "type": "String"
  }
]
"relations": [
  {
    "child_id": "String",
    "parent_id": "String",
    "type": "String"
  }
]

children.name: input.relations.child
children.text: Number
children.text2: Integer index of the CI object in the items array that represents the child in the relationship.

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.operation
children.text:
Operation that took place.

Possible values:

  • INSERT: New related CI was inserted into the database.
  • INSERT_AS_INCOMPLETE: Item was saved in cmdb_ire_incomplete_payloads table.
  • INSERT_AS_PARTIAL: Item was saved in cmdb_ire_partial_payloads table.
  • NO_CHANGE: No related CI changes were made.
  • UPDATE: Existing related CI was updated.
  • UPDATE_WITH_DOWNGRADE: Related CI was updated and the class changed to a more generic class (ancestor class).
  • UPDATE_WITH_SWITCH: Related CI was updated and the class changed to a class that is not ancestor or descendent.
  • UPDATE_WITH_UPDRADE: Related CI was updated and the class changed to a more specialized class (descendent class).

Data type: String

children.name: input.relations.child_id
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id of the child item in the relation.

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.sysId
children.text:
The sys_id of the related item.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.warningCount
children.text:
Number of warnings encountered when processing the related items.

Data type: Number

children.name: input.relations.parent
children.text: Number
children.text2: Integer index of the parent item in the items array.

children.name: input.relations.parent_id
children.text: String
children.text2: The internal_id of the parent item in the relation (item.related or item.lookup item).

children.name: <String>.items.relatedItems.warnings
input.relations.type
children.text: String
children.text2:
The type of relationship that exists between the parent
              and child items. This must be a name field value from the CI Relationship Type
              [cmdb_rel_type] table.

children.name: <String>.items.relatedSysIds
children.text:
List of the sys_id values of the CIs used during lookup-based identification of related items.

Data type: String

children.name: options
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Optional, but {} or null must be passed-in. Options to enable or disable features.
Note: By default or if partial_payloads is set to true, both partial_commits and deduplicate_payloads are enabled, even if they are set to false, as those features are essential for partial payloads functionality.
"options": { 
 "deduplicate_payloads": "Boolean",
 "generate_summary": "Boolean", 
 "partial_commits": "Boolean", 
 "partial_payloads": "Boolean"
}

children.name: <String>.items.sys_id
children.text:
Sys_id of the CI that was updated or created.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.relations
children.text:
List of JSON objects that provides information about the processed relations.

Data type: Array

"relations": [ 
  { 
    "className": "String",
    "errorCount": Number,
    "errors": [Array],
    "inputIndices": [Array],
    "operation": "String",
    "sysId": "String" 
  }
]

children.name: options.deduplicate_payloads
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether duplicate items are merged or considered errors.

Valid values:

  • true: Merge duplicate items.
  • false: Consider duplicate items as errors.

Default: true

children.name: <String>.relations.className
children.text:
Sys_class_name of this dependent relationship CI.
Only supported value:
  • cmdb_rel_ci: The CI Relationship table.

Data type: String

children.name: options.generate_summary
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether the returned results contain summary information. For the details of the returned summary information, see <String>.summary in the return results table.

Valid values:

  • true: Include summary information.
  • false: Do not include summary information.

Default: false

children.name: <String>.relations.errorCount
children.text:
Number of errors encountered when processing the dependent relationship CI.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.relations.errors
options.partial_commits
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether partial commit support is enabled. For additional information on partial commits, see Enhanced IRE features.

Valid values:

  • true: Partial commit enabled.
  • false: Partial commit disabled.

Default: true

children.name: source
children.text: String
children.text2:
Data source of the CI information. This value must be one of
              the choice values defined for the discovery_source field of the Configuration Item
              [cmdb_ci] table.

children.name: options.partial_payloads
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether partial payload support is enabled. For additional information on partial payloads, see Enhanced IRE features and Create an IRE data source rule.

Valid values:

  • true: Partial payload enabled.
  • false: Partial payload disabled.

Default: true

children.name: <String>.relations.inputIndices
children.text:
Indexes for the dependent relationship CI objects in the request body relations array that correspond to this dependent relationship CI.

Data type: Array

children.name: <String>.relations.operation
children.text:
Type of operation performed.

Possible values:

  • INSERT: The dependent relationship CI was inserted into the target table as a new record.
  • INSERT_AS_INCOMPLETE: The dependent relationship CI had errors and was inserted into the CMDB IRE Incomplete Payloads [cmdb_ire_incomplete_payloads] table.
  • INSERT_AS_PARTIAL: The dependent relationship CI had errors and was inserted into the CMDB IRE Partial Payloads [cmdb_ire_partial_payloads] table.
  • NO_CHANGE: No operation was performed.
  • UPDATE: An existing dependent relationship CI in the target table was updated.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.relations.sysId
children.text:
Sys_id of the dependent relationship CI.

Data type: String

children.name: <String>.summary
children.text:
List of JSON properties that provide statistics on how many items were inserted, updated, and such, per class.

Data type: Array

children.name: <String>.summary.<class_name>
children.text:
Statistics for a specific class.

Data type: Object

<class_name>: {
 "additionalInsertedItemCount": Number, 
 "errorCount": Number,
 "incompleteItemCount": Number,
 "insertedItemCount": Number,
 "partialItemCount": Number,
 "skippedItemCount": Number,
 "unchangedItemCount": Number,
 "updatedItemCount": Number,
 "warningCount": Number 
}

children.name: <String>.summary.<class_name>.additionalInsertedItemCount
children.text:
Number of items inserted due to processing of partial payloads.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.summary.<class_name>.errorCount
children.text:
Number of errors encounter when processing items.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.summary.<class_name>.incompleteItemCount
children.text:
Number of items inserted in the CMDB IRE Incomplete Payloads [cmdb_ire_incomplete_payloads] table.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.summary.<class_name>.insertedItemCount

Number of items created.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.summary.<class_name>.partialItemCount
children.text:
Number of items saved in the Partial Payload table [cmdb_ire_partial_payloads].

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.summary.<class_name>.skippedItemCount
children.text:
Number of items that were skipped.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.summary.<class_name>.unchangedItemCount
children.text:
Number of items that had entries but were not modified.

Data type: Number

children.name: <String>.summary.<class_name>.updatedItemCount

Number of items updated.

children.text:
Number of items that generated a warning when processed.

children.name: identifyCIEnhanced(String source, String input, Object options)
children.text: Determines the Configuration Management Database (CMDB) operation (insert/update) to perform with the specified payload (request body), without committing the operations in the database.
children.text2:
Use this method to simulate submission of a payload.

This method is similar to the IdentificationEngine - identifyCI(String jsonString) method, however it also supports the following functionality:

  • Partial payloads
    • In case of an item having a warning or error, indicates if an item operation is INSERT_AS_PARTIAL or INSERT_INCOMPLETE.
    • Returns the sys_ids of partial payloads that were merged with existing partial payloads.
  • Supports payload deduplicate feature.
  • Generates a summary.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: gr
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
The CI on which to run the audit to detect duplicates. The CI must have
                independent identification rules.

children.name: Example
children.text: var sysId = '<cbdb_ci_sys_id>'; var gr = new GlideRecord('cmdb_ci_linux_server'); gr.get(sysId); SNC.IdentificationEngineScriptableApi.runIdentificationAudit(gr);
children.text2:
The following  shows how to check a record in the Linux Servers
        [cmdb_ci_linux_server] table for duplicates.

children.name: runIdentificationAudit(GlideRecord gr)
children.text:
Runs an identification audit against the specified configuration item (CI) to detect
    duplicates.
children.text2: If duplicates are found, duplication tasks are created. Only use this method on CI types with independent identification rules.

name: IdentificationEngine
text: The IdentificationEngine API uses the Identification and Reconciliation framework to minimize the creation of duplicate configuration items (CIs) and to reconcile CI attributes by only accepting information from authorized data sources when updating the Configuration Management Database (CMDB).
text2: When using this class in a scoped application, use the sn_cmdb namespace identifier.
